intro: Jurinea carduicephala, commonly known as the desert hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, succulent stems. The plant has a low-growing, cushion-like growth form, which helps it conserve water in harsh environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, reducing water loss through transpiration. Jurinea carduicephala is adapted to survive in extreme conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
